conclusion: Analyze the path of the car and its interaction with the blocks.
Car A starts from the lower right corner of the image and moves towards the center-left area where the blocks are located.
Car A will first encounter the red block as it is positioned directly in the path of car A.
Car A will be deflected due to the impact with the red block. The direction of deflection depends on the angle of collision and the properties of the car and the block.
Assuming a direct hit and no significant deflection, car A will continue moving after the initial collision with the red block.
After the initial collision with the red block, car A will likely move towards another block, the green block, positioned slightly to the left of the red block.
Upon colliding with the green block, car A will again be deflected. The direction of this deflection will depend on the angle of collision and the properties of the car and the block.
Car A will continue moving until it either stops or collides with another block, likely stopping near the blue block.
Car A will collide with the red block first, then the green block, and finally come to a stop near the blue block.
